alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 2:16PM MDT until June 23 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Garfield County in southern Utah... Southeastern Wayne County in southern Utah... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 216 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes, slot canyons and slickrock areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hanksville. This includes the following highways... Utah Route 95 between mile markers 2 and 23. This includes the following streams and drainages... Hells Hole Canyon, Little Bull, Little White Roost, Robbers Roost, Poison Springs Canyon and other drainages in the area. This warning also includes the Dirty Devil from the confluence with the Fremont south 25 miles. This warning may need to be extended southward if flows are high on the Dirty Devil. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
